headline: Why Deere (DE) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of agricultural and construction machinery company Deere (NYSE:DE) fell 7.9% in the morning session after the company reported second-quarter results that, despite beating revenue expectations, showed a significant year-over-year decline in profitability. While the company's revenue grew 5.5% year-over-year to $12.02 billion, surpassing analyst forecasts, investors focused on the weakening bottom line. Deere's earnings per share fell to $4.75 from $6.29 in the same quarter last year, alth

headline: Deere tariff outlook, mortgage rates hit 2025 low, Li downgrade
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Deere (DE) stock is slipping after the company forecast a $600 million tariff hit for 2025. Mortgage rates fell to their lowest level of 2025 so far, according to weekly mortgage rate data from Freddie Mac (FMCC). Li Auto (LI) was downgraded to Neutral from Overweight by JPMorgan. The firm also lowered its price target for Li to $5 from $28. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Deere Braces for an Autumn of Tariffs
summary: Deere raised its expected cost for tariffs this year, anticipating that expenses will accelerate rapidly this fall.  Deere said Thursday that it expects to pay $600 million for duties during its fiscal year ending in October, up from $500 million forecast earlier this year.  Through the past three quarters, the farm and construction machinery manufacturer said it paid about $300 million, meaning that its tariff costs for the current quarter are likely to total another $300 million.

raw.headline: Deere Braces for an Autumn of Tariffs
raw.summary: Deere raised its expected cost for tariffs this year, anticipating that expenses will accelerate rapidly this fall.  Deere said Thursday that it expects to pay $600 million for duties during its fiscal year ending in October, up from $500 million forecast earlier this year.  Through the past three quarters, the farm and construction machinery manufacturer said it paid about $300 million, meaning that its tariff costs for the current quarter are likely to total another $300 million.

headline: Deere (DE) Reports Lower Q3 Earnings And Revises 2025 Guidance
summary: Deere (DE) recently reported its third-quarter earnings, revealing a 1% decline in sales compared to the previous year, alongside a cautious earnings guidance adjustment for fiscal 2025 due to challenging economic conditions. Despite these results, Deere's stock rose by 1% over the past month, slightly outpacing a broader stock market that also gained. Factors such as the launch of the new Operations Center PRO Service likely softened the impact of the otherwise subdued earnings report...

headline: Hot PPI Inflation Cools Big Fed Rate-Cut Hopes; S&P 500 Falls
summary: Today's producer price index and jobless claims data may not do much to lower the volume on calls for multiple near-term Federal Reserve rate cuts, with the Trump administration leading the way.  The S&P 500 fell modestly after the data, following Wednesday's close at a new record high.  Deere is among the big S&P 500 losers early Thursday amid a tempered earnings outlook as it navigates Trump tariffs.

Deere (DE) stock is falling after the company lowered its outlook, as uncertainty among its customers weighs on sales. headline: Deere Reports Third Quarter Net Income of $1.289 Billion
summary: Deere & Company (NYSE: DE) reported net income of $1.289 billion for the third quarter ended July 27, 2025, or $4.75 per share, compared with net income of $1.734 billion, or $6.29 per share, for the quarter ended July 28, 2024. For the first nine months of the year, net income attributable to Deere & Company was $3.962 billion, or $14.57 per share, compared with $5.855 billion, or $21.04 per share, for the same period last year.

raw.headline: Deere Reports Third Quarter Net Income of $1.289 Billion

For the first nine months of the year, net income attributable to Deere & Company was $3.962 billion, or $14.57 per share, compared with $5.855 billion, or $21.04 per share, for the same period last year.

headline: Deere's quarterly profit falls as US tariffs hit farm equipment margins
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs have impacted companies across sectors, with the manufacturing and industrial firms taking the biggest hit.  Global companies that reported between July 16 and August 8 have projected a combined financial hit of $13.6 billion to $15.2 billion for the full year, a Reuters' global tariff tracker shows.  Trump has said the tariffs are a response to persistent U.S. trade imbalances and declining manufacturing power, and that the moves will bring jobs and investment to the nation.

Trump has said the tariffs are a response to persistent U.S. trade imbalances and declining manufacturing power, and that the moves will bring jobs and investment to the nation.

summary: The United States agricultural tractor market is projected to grow from US$ 20.73 billion in 2024 to US$ 32.1 billion by 2033, driven by a CAGR of 4.98%.
